snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had threatened lawmakers with establishing this panel if they did not pass the anticorruption bills he had proposed.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo follows through on his threat to establish a commission to investigate public corruption after flurry of scandals involving state legislators; says 25-member panel will have two goals: to pursue cases of misconduct among public officials and to recommend changes to state’s election and campaign fund-raising laws.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had threatened lawmakers with establishing this panel if they did not pass the anticorruption bills he had proposed.

headline.main: Cuomo Creates Special Commission to Investigate Corrupt Elected Officials
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Creates Special Commission to Investigate Corrupt Elected Officials
